00057 static int ntp_read_prefs (struct arglist *);
00058 static int ntp_long_attack (struct arglist *);

00064 int
00065 ntp_parse_input (struct arglist *globals, char *input)
00066 {
00067   char *str;
00068   int result = 1;               /* default return value is 1 */
00069 
00070   str = strstr (input, " <|> ");
00071   if (str == NULL)
00072     return 1;
00073 
00074   str[0] = '\0';
00075 
00076   if (strcmp (input, "CLIENT") == 0)
00077     {
00078       input = str + 5;
00079       str = strchr (input, ' ');
00080       if (str != NULL)
00081         str[0] = '\0';
00082 
00083       if (input[strlen (input) - 1] == '\n')
00084         input[strlen (input) - 1] = '\0';
00085 
00086       switch (otp_get_client_request (input))
00087         {
00088         case CREQ_ATTACHED_FILE:
00089           ntp_recv_file (globals);
00090           break;
00091 
00092         case CREQ_LONG_ATTACK:
00093           result = ntp_long_attack (globals);
00094           break;
00095 
00096         case CREQ_OPENVAS_VERSION:
00097           otp_server_openvas_version (globals);
00098           break;
00099 
00100         case CREQ_PAUSE_WHOLE_TEST:
00101           log_write ("Pausing the whole test (requested by client)");
00102           hosts_pause_all ();
00103           result = NTP_PAUSE_WHOLE_TEST;
00104           break;
00105 
00106         case CREQ_PLUGIN_INFO:
00107           {
00108             char *t, *s;
00109             t = strstr (&(str[1]), " <|> ");
00110             if (t == NULL)
00111               {
00112                 result = -1;
00113                 break;
00114               }
00115             s = t + 5;
00116             plugin_send_infos (globals, s);
00117             break;
00118           }
00119 
00120         case CREQ_PREFERENCES:
00121           ntp_read_prefs (globals);
00122           break;
00123 
00124         case CREQ_RESUME_WHOLE_TEST:
00125           log_write ("Resuming the whole test (requested by client)");
00126           hosts_resume_all ();
00127           arg_del_value (globals, "stop_required");
00128           result = NTP_RESUME_WHOLE_TEST;
00129           break;
00130 
00131         case CREQ_STOP_WHOLE_TEST:
00132           log_write ("Stopping the whole test (requested by client)");
00133           arg_add_value (globals, "stop_required", ARG_INT, sizeof (int),
00134                          GSIZE_TO_POINTER (1));
00135           hosts_stop_all ();
00136           result = NTP_STOP_WHOLE_TEST;
00137           break;
00138 
00139         case CREQ_STOP_ATTACK:
00140           {
00141             char *t, *s;
00142             s = str + 5;
00143             t = strstr (s, " <|> ");
00144             if (t == NULL)
00145               {
00146                 result = -1;
00147                 break;
00148               }
00149             t[0] = '\0';
00150             log_write ("Stopping attack against %s\n", s);
00151             hosts_stop_host (s);
00152             arg_add_value (globals, "stop_required", ARG_INT, sizeof (int),
00153                            GSIZE_TO_POINTER (1));
00154             ntp_timestamp_host_scan_interrupted (globals, s);
00155             break;
00156           }
00157 
00158         case CREQ_NVT_INFO:
00159           {
00160             comm_send_nvt_info (globals);
00161             comm_send_preferences (globals);
00162             break;
00163           }
00164 
00165         case CREQ_UNKNOWN:
00166           break;
00167         }
00168     }
00169 
00170   return (result);
00171 }
00172 
00173 static int
00174 ntp_long_attack (struct arglist *globals)
00175 {
00176   struct arglist *preferences = arg_get_value (globals, "preferences");
00177   int soc = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "global_socket"));
00178   char input[16384];
00179   int size;
00180   char *target;
00181   char *plugin_set;
00182   int n;
00183 
00184   n = recv_line (soc, input, sizeof (input) - 1);
00185   if (n <= 0)
00186     return -1;
00187 
00188 #if DEBUGMORE
00189   printf ("long_attack :%s\n", input);
00190 #endif
00191   if (!strncmp (input, "<|> CLIENT", sizeof ("<|> CLIENT")))
00192     return 1;
00193   size = atoi (input);
00194   target = emalloc (size + 1);
00195 
00196   n = 0;
00197   while (n < size)
00198     {
00199       int e;
00200       e = nrecv (soc, target + n, size - n, 0);
00201       if (e > 0)
00202         n += e;
00203       else
00204         return -1;
00205     }
00206   plugin_set = arg_get_value (preferences, "plugin_set");
00207   if (!plugin_set || plugin_set[0] == '\0')
00208     {
00209       plugin_set = emalloc (3);
00210       sprintf (plugin_set, "-1");
00211       if (!arg_get_value (preferences, "plugin_set"))
00212         arg_add_value (preferences, "plugin_set", ARG_STRING,
00213                        strlen (plugin_set), plugin_set);
00214       else
00215         arg_set_value (preferences, "plugin_set", strlen (plugin_set),
00216                        plugin_set);
00217     }
00218 
00219   comm_setup_plugins (globals, plugin_set);
00220   if (arg_get_value (preferences, "TARGET"))
00221     {
00222       char *old = arg_get_value (preferences, "TARGET");
00223       efree (&old);
00224       arg_set_value (preferences, "TARGET", strlen (target), target);
00225     }
00226   else
00227     arg_add_value (preferences, "TARGET", ARG_STRING, strlen (target), target);
00228   return 0;
00229 }
00230 
00237 static int
00238 ntp_read_prefs (struct arglist *globals)
00239 {
00240   struct arglist *preferences = arg_get_value (globals, "preferences");
00241   int soc = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "global_socket"));
00242   char *input;
00243   int input_sz = 1024 * 1024 * 2; /* this is sufficient for a plugin_set
00244                                      for upto 69K OIDs */ 
00245 
00246   input = emalloc (input_sz);
00247   for (;;)
00248     {
00249       int n;
00250       input[0] = '\0';
00251 #if DEBUG_SSL > 2
00252       log_write ("ntp_read_prefs > soc=%d\n", soc);
00253 #endif
00254       n = recv_line (soc, input, input_sz - 1);
00255 
00256       if (n < 0 || input[0] == '\0')
00257         {
00258           log_write ("Empty data string -- closing comm. channel\n");
00259           exit (0);
00260         }
00261 
00262       if (strstr (input, "<|> CLIENT") != NULL) /* finished = 1; */
00263         break;
00264       /* else */
00265 
00266       {
00267         char *pref;
00268         char *v;
00269         char *old;
00270         pref = input;
00271         v = strchr (input, '<');
00272         if (v)
00273           {
00274             char *value;
00275             v -= 1;
00276             v[0] = 0;
00277 
00278             value = v + 5;
00279             /*
00280              * "system" prefs can't be changed
00281              */
00282             if (is_scanner_only_pref (pref))
00283               continue;
00284 
00285             old = arg_get_value (preferences, pref);
00286 #ifdef DEBUGMORE
00287             printf ("%s - %s (old : %s)\n", pref, value, old);
00288 #endif
00289             if (value[0] != '\0')
00290               value[strlen (value) - 1] = '\0';
00291 
00292             if (old != NULL)
00293               {
00294                 if (strcmp (old, value) != 0)
00295                   {
00296                     efree (&old);
00297                     v = estrdup (value);
00298                     arg_set_value (preferences, pref, strlen (v), v);
00299                   }
00300               }
00301             else
00302               {
00303                 v = estrdup (value);
00304                 arg_add_value (preferences, pref, ARG_STRING, strlen (v), v);
00305               }
00306           }
00307       }
00308     }
00309 
00310   efree (&input);
00311   return (0);
00312 }

00326 static void
00327 files_add_translation (struct arglist *globals, const char *remotename,
00328                        char *contents)
00329 {
00330   GHashTable *trans = arg_get_value (globals, "files_translation");
00331   // Register the mapping table if none there yet
00332   if (trans == NULL)
00333     {
00334       trans = g_hash_table_new_full (g_str_hash, g_str_equal, g_free, g_free);
00335       arg_add_value (globals, "files_translation", ARG_PTR, -1, trans);
00336     }
00337 
00338   g_hash_table_insert (trans, g_strdup (remotename), contents);
00339 }
00340 
00353 static void
00354 files_add_size_translation (struct arglist *globals, const char *remotename,
00355                             const long filesize)
00356 {
00357   GHashTable *trans = arg_get_value (globals, "files_size_translation");
00358   gchar *filesize_str = g_strdup_printf ("%ld", filesize);
00359 
00360   // Register the mapping table if none there yet
00361   if (trans == NULL)
00362     {
00363       trans = g_hash_table_new_full (g_str_hash, g_str_equal, g_free, NULL);
00364       arg_add_value (globals, "files_size_translation", ARG_PTR, -1, trans);
00365     }
00366 
00367   g_hash_table_insert (trans, g_strdup (remotename), g_strdup (filesize_str));
00368 }

00383 static void
00384 build_global_host_sshlogins_map (struct arglist *globals, char *keyfiledata)
00385 {
00386   // Deserialize the hashtable that mapped login-account names to host names.
00387   GHashTable *map_host_sshlogin_name =
00388     hash_table_file_read_text (keyfiledata, strlen (keyfiledata));
00389   // Add or replace it in the arglist
00390   if (map_host_sshlogin_name != NULL
00391       && arg_get_value (globals, "MAP_HOST_SSHLOGIN_NAME") == NULL)
00392     arg_add_value (globals, "MAP_HOST_SSHLOGIN_NAME", ARG_PTR, -1,
00393                    map_host_sshlogin_name);
00394   else if (map_host_sshlogin_name != NULL)
00395     arg_set_value (globals, "MAP_HOST_SSHLOGIN_NAME", -1,
00396                    map_host_sshlogin_name);
00397 }
00398 
00411 static void
00412 build_global_sshlogin_info_map (struct arglist *globals, char *keyfiledata)
00413 {
00414   // Read the buffer, build map of names->structs
00415   GHashTable *ssh_logins =
00416     openvas_ssh_login_file_read_buffer (keyfiledata, strlen (keyfiledata), FALSE);
00417   // Add/ Replace, if not-empty
00418   if (ssh_logins != NULL
00419       && arg_get_value (globals, "MAP_NAME_SSHLOGIN") == NULL)
00420     arg_add_value (globals, "MAP_NAME_SSHLOGIN", ARG_PTR, -1, ssh_logins);
00421   else if (ssh_logins != NULL)
00422     arg_set_value (globals, "MAP_NAME_SSHLOGIN", -1, ssh_logins);
00423 }

00437 int
00438 ntp_recv_file (struct arglist *globals)
00439 {
00440   int soc = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "global_socket"));
00441   char input[4096];
00442   char *origname, *contents;
00443   gchar *cont_ptr = NULL;
00444   int n;
00445   long bytes = 0;
00446   long tot = 0;
00447 
00448   n = recv_line (soc, input, sizeof (input) - 1);
00449   if (n <= 0)
00450     return -1;
00451 
00452   if (strncmp (input, "name: ", strlen ("name: ")) == 0)
00453     {
00454       origname = estrdup (input + sizeof ("name: ") - 1);
00455       if (origname[strlen (origname) - 1] == '\n')
00456         origname[strlen (origname) - 1] = '\0';
00457     }
00458   else
00459     return -1;
00460 
00461   n = recv_line (soc, input, sizeof (input) - 1);
00462   if (n <= 0)
00463     return -1;
00464   /* XXX content: message. Ignored for the moment */
00465 
00466   n = recv_line (soc, input, sizeof (input) - 1);
00467   if (n <= 0)
00468     return -1;
00469 
00470   if (strncmp (input, "bytes: ", sizeof ("bytes: ") - 1) == 0)
00471     {
00472       char *t = input + sizeof ("bytes: ") - 1;
00473       bytes = atol (t);
00474     }
00475   else
00476     return -1;
00477 
00478   /* We now know that we have to read <bytes> bytes from the remote socket. */
00479 
00480   contents = g_try_malloc0 (bytes);
00481 
00482   if (contents == NULL)
00483     {
00484       log_write ("ntp_recv_file: Failed to allocate memory for uploaded file.");
00485       return -1;
00486     }
00487 
00488   cont_ptr = contents;
00489   while (tot < bytes)
00490     {
00491       bzero (input, sizeof (input));
00492       n = nrecv (soc, input, MIN (sizeof (input) - 1, bytes - tot), 0);
00493       if (n < 0)
00494         {
00495           char s[80];
00496           sprintf (s, "11_recv_file: nrecv(%d)", soc);
00497           perror (s);
00498           break;
00499         }
00500       else
00501         {
00502           memcpy ((cont_ptr + (tot * sizeof (char))), &input, n);
00503           tot += n;
00504         }
00505     }
00506   auth_printf (globals, "SERVER <|> FILE_ACCEPTED <|> SERVER\n");
00507   /* Add the fact that what the remote client calls <filename> is actually
00508    * stored in <contents> here and has a size of <bytes> bytes. */
00509   files_add_translation (globals, origname, contents);
00510   files_add_size_translation (globals, origname, bytes);
00511 
00512   // Check for files that are handled in a special manner access per-host
00513   // login information.
00514   gchar *origname_file = g_path_get_basename (origname);
00515   if (!strcmp (origname_file, ".host_sshlogins"))
00516     {
00517       build_global_host_sshlogins_map (globals, contents);
00518     }
00519   else if (!strcmp (origname_file, ".logins"))
00520     {
00521       build_global_sshlogin_info_map (globals, contents);
00522     }
00523 
00524   g_free (origname);
00525   g_free (origname_file);
00526 
00527   return 0;
00528 }

00537 static int
00538 __ntp_timestamp_scan (struct arglist *globals, char *msg)
00539 {
00540   char timestr[1024];
00541   char *tmp;
00542   time_t t;
00543   int len;
00544 
00545   t = time (NULL);
00546   tmp = ctime (&t);
00547   timestr[sizeof (timestr) - 1] = '\0';
00548   strncpy (timestr, tmp, sizeof (timestr) - 1);
00549   len = strlen (timestr);
00550   if (timestr[len - 1] == '\n')
00551     timestr[len - 1] = '\0';
00552 
00553   auth_printf (globals, "SERVER <|> TIME <|> %s <|> %s <|> SERVER\n", msg,
00554                timestr);
00555   return 0;
00556 }
00557 
00558 
00559 static int
00560 __ntp_timestamp_scan_host (struct arglist *globals, char *msg, char *host)
00561 {
00562   char timestr[1024];
00563   char *tmp;
00564   time_t t;
00565   int len;
00566   char buf[1024];
00567   int soc;
00568 
00569   t = time (NULL);
00570   tmp = ctime (&t);
00571   timestr[sizeof (timestr) - 1] = '\0';
00572   strncpy (timestr, tmp, sizeof (timestr) - 1);
00573   len = strlen (timestr);
00574   if (timestr[len - 1] == '\n')
00575     timestr[len - 1] = '\0';
00576 
00577   soc = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "global_socket"));
00578 
00579   snprintf (buf, sizeof (buf),
00580             "SERVER <|> TIME <|> %s <|> %s <|> %s <|> SERVER\n", msg, host,
00581             timestr);
00582 
00583   internal_send (soc, buf, INTERNAL_COMM_MSG_TYPE_DATA);
00584 
00585   return 0;
00586 }

00589 int
00590 ntp_timestamp_scan_starts (struct arglist *globals)

00592   return __ntp_timestamp_scan (globals, "SCAN_START");

00596 ntp_timestamp_scan_ends (struct arglist *globals)

00598   return __ntp_timestamp_scan (globals, "SCAN_END");
